content.description: Traverse route along the Wilson Way Boulder. Start w/ right hand sloper and left hand crimp. Make your way up and to the left following the red hand and blue foot marks. Once you’re over to the farthest side shown, top out big for the send.
Sit start on the side facing the paved trail. Two good holds allow a move to the top of the boulder.
content.location: Start on the side facing the paved trail.

content.description: Sit start with handholds pictured in red and footholds in blue. Left hand crimp, right hand sloper, left foot on a tiny sloping edge. Right foot up to smear on sloper and right hand to small two finger crimp. Match left foot on the sloper and top out.

Start seated, L hand on a Crimp side pull and R hand on a sloper on the arete. Bump the L hand to another sharp crimp, bump the right hand to another sloper higher up the arete, stand up on some tiny feet and throw for the top out. Short And Contrived. But it’s real rock and it’s outdoors. It’s around V3-4 if you only use the holds listed above, it can be made a bit easier if you use different start holds, or some bigger holds on the L arete.
content.location: Facing the running path, the tallest section of the boulder

content.description: Sit start with handholds pictured in red and footholds in blue. First move to stand with a left hand crimp and right hand undercling and a tiny foothold. Left foot up to smear and hand up to a great center hold, match and reach for a left hand side-pull to bring your right foot up for the last foothold and top out.
